issue.title: [C++] Add Buffer implementation and helper functions for POSIX shared memory
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1385](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1385). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This should also include affordances for detaching and removing shm segments

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1385?focusedCommentId=16136193) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
May be be possible to make this portable to Windows, too. See reference at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa366551(v=vs.85).aspx

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1385?focusedCommentId=16156243) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This is not time-sensitive for 0.7.0

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1385?focusedCommentId=17195491) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Is there a target use case we're thinking about? Otherwise it's not obvious this deserves keeping an issue open.
(especially, one annoyance with shared memory is garbage collecting unused shared memory segments: Windows is able to do this automatically, Unix unfortunately is not)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1385?focusedCommentId=17285902) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Will close for now.
